findings.title: Possible absence of NFT with RootId
findings.description: mintFragment() will never work unless the NFT with rootid is minted.

findings.title: Centralization of setWinners()
findings.description: Only owner can call setWinners(), leading to unfair distribution of rewards.

findings.title: Handle error when staking to non-existent pool
findings.description: Transaction will revert with panic code 0x32 error if user stakes into non-existent pool.

findings.title: Unsafe to rely on isContract()
findings.description: Use of isContract() is unsafe as it may return false for certain types of addresses.

findings.title: Redundant code block
findings.description: numFinishedSalesDelta will always be zero and else block won't execute.

findings.title: Missing Zero Address Check
findings.description: Contracts lack zero address checks, prone to initialization with zero addresses.

findings.title: Denial of service to the user while claiming NFT
findings.description: User can't claim NFT if staked amount is equal to minTotalStake due to require check.

findings.title: Redundant Statements
findings.description: amountRefund will always be 0 or greater than 0 due to unsigned integer declaration.

findings.title: Modifier launchpadNotFound checks <= instead of only <
findings.description: Modifier checks for <=, causing issues if entered launchpadId is equal to launchpads.length.

findings.title: Unnecessary use of nonReentrant modifier
findings.description: setWinners() function doesn't have external calls, making nonReentrant modifier unnecessary.

findings.title: Unnecessary use of storage keyword
findings.description: Some functions use storage keyword instead of memory, potentially wasting gas.

findings.title: Incorrect comment and error message
findings.description: Comment and error message in addUserCheckpoint() don't match code logic.

findings.title: Incorrect launchpad count
findings.description: deleteLaunchpad() doesn't delete launchpad from launchpads array, causing incorrect count.

findings.title: Part A- Userâ€™s Ether can get stuck in the contract
findings.description: If statement on line 325 fails to execute for NFTs with non-zero tokenAddresses.

findings.title: Part B- Malicious admin can withdraw all stuck ether
findings.description: Admin can use withdraw() function to steal stuck ether without refunding buyers.

findings.title: Non-owner can burn any NFT
findings.description: Admin can burn any root token even if not owned by the admin.

findings.title: setPool will always revert
findings.description: setPool() function will always revert due to zero address check and incorrect yfiagPool initialization.

findings.title: Part A- Denial of Service via setDefaultAmountEarn()
findings.description: Malicious EOA can wipe out user rewards by setting amountEarn equal to zero.

findings.title: Part B- Potential Denial of Service via setPool()
findings.description: Admin changing pool address can lead to potential Denial of Service attacks for subowners.

findings.title: Uninitialized YFIAGPool and _launchpad
findings.description: YFIAGPool and _launchpad will be zero addresses if not set manually or forgotten to set using the setPool() and setLaunchPad() functions.

findings.title: Admin can withdraw all funds and Deny subowner fees
findings.description: The function withdrawAdmin() allows the admin to withdraw all Ether at any point of time, thus withdrawing the funds that are meant only for the subowners.

findings.title: For loop over Dynamic array
findings.description: The length of the _subOwners array can increase when admin or launchPad mints NFTs via the mintFragment() function, leading to out-of-gas errors and consistently failed execution of the buy() function.

findings.title: Use of transferFrom instead of transfer
findings.description: Using transferFrom instead of transfer may revert with an insufficient allowance error.

findings.title: Missing Zero Address Check
findings.description: Contracts lack zero address checks, hence are prone to be initialized with zero addresses.

findings.title: Misleading name/execution of burnByLaunchPad()
findings.description: The function burnByLaunchpad() can also be called by admin, not just Launchpad.

findings.title: Transaction Order Dependence in setPriceAndSell() and buy()
findings.description: A buyer can frontrun his own transaction to buy the NFT at a possibly cheaper price.

findings.title: Missing events for Critical functions
findings.description: Missing events for functions carrying out critical operations.

findings.title: Usage of ERC721Enumerable pattern is costly
findings.description: The ERC721 Enumerable contract's pattern has been used in the Modified ERC721 contract, which is highly costly in terms of gas costs.

findings.title: Private key visible
findings.description: The initial code contained a private key in one of its test files and was visible due to the repo being public.
